intro: Lotononis amajubica, commonly known as the Natal daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Lotononis amajubica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
